846364374:
[

Principal Signalling Engineer

Company Name Siemens Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 44 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

From locomotives, trains and trams, to rail infrastructure including electrification, communications, control systems and signalling systems, Siemens has a comprehensive range of solutions to enable safe and accessible mobility across Australia and New Zealand. As well as rail transport, we also offer solutions in airport logistics postal automation and intelligent transport technologies.

Opportunity has arisen for 3 experienced Principal Signalling Engineers to join the Siemens Mobility Signalling Design Team in Melbourne. The successful candidates will have the opportunity to work within the one of the core engineering areas of the Siemens Mobility business and provide Signalling Design solutions to our Railway customers in Victoria and around Australia.

The scope of supported activities includes technical solution analysis, design checking, team leadership, tendering and independent review. This position will be allocated to the Advanced Solutions team.

To Be Considered For This Role You Will Have
  • A strong technical knowledge of railway systems and equipment
  • At least 10 years’ experience in Signalling Design activities on Customer Projects (preferably with SoC working within the Victorian Railway).
  • Formal technical qualification to degree standard in Electrical Engineering or related discipline is preferred though not essential.
  • Existing formal rail design competency approvals, or ability to attain formal approvals under Australian/New Zealand operator regulatory competency frameworks (e.g. ARA, IRSE, Queensland Rail, MTM, Rail Safety Worker Card etc.) Current MTM competencies are highly desirable.
  • Awareness and experience in other railway system domains is an advantage (e.g. Train Control, Comms, ATP, ETCS, CBTC etc)
  • Good communication skills with the ability to work in a team environment.
In return for your commitment to Siemens, you will be rewarded with a challenging and stimulating work environment, as well as a very attractive remuneration package including performance based incentive payments.

If you would like further information about this opportunity, please contact Austen Williams on 03 9721 2351 for a confidential discussion.

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 41 views

Job description

Lablemakers is the largest and an innovative manufacturer and supplier of Labels and Packaging materials to blue chip companies. We are seeking a motivated and experienced Sales / BD Manager, who can further increase, grow and exceed our already solid and successful business and create new sales pipelines.


You must demonstrate:

  • Proven track record in developing new business and sales pipelines.
  • Having previous experience in label and packaging industry will be an advantage.
  • Confident and positive attitude with having emotional intelligent.
  • A highly effective communicator at all levels.
  • Exhibit excellent attention to detail.
  • Ability to work in both a team environment or autonomously.


You are required to:

  • Develop and obtain profitable new business opportunities, as well as growing sales of existing Labelmakers customers.
  • Liaise with the clients and to draft contracts and tenders as required.
  • Travel regularly to meet with clients - and some interstate travels may be needed.
  • Closely monitor sales orders and delivery deadlines - with regular feedback to customers.
  • Prepare Business Development and annual Sales Operating Plans.\xa0
  • Follow up and work with planners and production teams to ensure delivery on deadlines.


We are excited to offer this full-time position to and reward a person who is confident and enjoys a challenge and wants to grow with our business. Selected candidate will be required to do a basic Pre-employment medical.


If you have the passion and confident in growing our sales and customer satisfaction and you have the experience to do what it takes.....APPLY NOW!

Training Senior Specialist/Option of 3-5 day week/Pro-rata

Company Name Mazda Australia Pty Ltd Company Location Mulgrave, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 52 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Confident, Driven, Ambitious with the flexibility of a 3, 4 or 5 day week!


Are you looking for a role where you can really make a difference? Mazda Australia is looking for a dynamic Frontline Training Senior Specialist to join the National Learning and Development team based in Mulgrave Victoria.


You’ll have the opportunity to play a key role in the development and implementation of best practice frontline training across the Mazda dealer network. As a leading automotive brand, we’re all about helping skill our dealers to offer the Ultimate Customer Experience.


The key to success is the relationships you’ll develop across the business with internal business units, the wider Mazda Australia dealer network & a host of top quality external providers. Degree qualified, you’ll bring a strong understanding of learning methodologies and experience in customer service.


It goes without saying that you’ll be a first class communicator – a true professional with the capacity to engage and facilitate high quality learning. You thrive upon challenges offered by our amazing industry and enjoy leading others to success.


Enjoy having some flexibility? 3, 4 or 5 days (Pro rata of FTE Salary) - The choice is yours.


At Mazda, it’s Stylish, Spirited, Insightful thinking that has resulted in the creation of some amazing driving technology that inspires our employees and customers around Australia. We offer incredible benefits including flexible working hours, access to great cars for you and your family, on site car parking, opportunities to purchase additional leave and a commitment to internal development and promotion.

\xa0

Interested? Send your details to careers@mazda.com.au quoting reference FTS-VIC-1 in the subject line. Applications close on Friday, 21 September 2018.

[

Property Manager

Company Name Capstone Recruitment Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 78 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

      • In-house role for leading blue-chip business
      • Retail, office and specialised property
      • Tenant-side experienced property operator



The Company

The company is a diverse corporate with multiple brands. The centralised property division provides expert services to the operating brands, including strategy, site acquisitions, branch/store fit-out, refurbishments and lease management.

The Opportunity

The group has undergone a recent restructure, resulting in opportunities for 2 corporate property managers to join the national team. These roles will focus on the property management of a defined portfolio of properties. The successful applicants will work closely with the internal stakeholders to aligned property services including lease transactions, exercising options, renewals, rent reviews, fit-out and make good negotiations, exit strategies and new site / location identification.

You will lead your portfolio of properties in an autonomous way, responsible for decision making aligned with the business strategy.

You will be working collaboratively with a team of internal property professionals, each with vast experience in occupier property matters including leasing, management, development and project management. You will be required to build sustainable relationships with external stakeholders including property landlords, agents, lawyers, facilities management providers and contractors.

Your Experience

The role will require prior experience in representing the tenant in lease negotiations, either directly or as a service provider. Ideally, you will be tertiary qualified, with extensive knowledge of commercial property.

You will be required to travel to branches/stores and other property assets, with that applicants must be willing to travel on a weekly basis.

\xa0
How to Apply

To apply please email jon@capstonerecruitment.com.au or call Jon Isaac on (03) 9005 3908 for more information.

Job description

About CHT

Situated in the heart of Collingwood , we are a medium sized modern Architectural design practice with projects ranging across a broad number of sectors including multi residential, aged care; commercial and workplaces, hospitality, education and high end residential just to name a few.

\xa0

The Role
A Greenfield in-house legal role, this position is ready for someone to make their mark.

\xa0

You will be responsible for providing legal advice in relation to all facets of the business including:

\xa0

  • Legal advice on general corporate and commercial matters
  • High quality and timely legal advice to our team of directors
  • Contract review, negotiation and drafting of agreements,
  • Registration and protection of intellectual property rights';
  • Liaison with regulatory bodies and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements;
  • Providing advice to our HR Manager on employment law issues;


The successful applicant will:

  • At least 4 years PQE in corporate and commercial law with a current practising certificate;
  • Commercially minded and professional with excellent communication skills;
  • A 'common-sense' approach when handling legal matters that balances legal requirements with commercial considerations
  • High attention to detail;
  • Good drafting and negotiating skills;
  • A well rounded individual with experience in general commercial, corporate and property law at a reputable employer;
  • Experience providing timely, relevant, commercial and corporate advice;
  • The ability to work autonomously

\xa0

This is a rare part time opportunity, which would ideally would suit a return to work parent as we are flexible in regards to the structure of the part time hours.

862977525:
[

General Manager Operations

Company Name NGO Recruitment Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 23 hours ago Number of views 262 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Be part of the vision to create a welcoming Australia for people seeking asylum
  • GM role responsible for the operations of Australia’s largest asylum seeker advocacy, aid and health organisation
  • Would suit candidates from complex community organisations who have experience in transformational project delivery

\xa0

The Organisation
The Asylum Seeker Resource Centre (ASRC) is both a place and a movement. An independent not-for-profit organisation, whose programs support and empower people seeking asylum. As a movement, they mobilise and unite communities to create lasting social and policy change. Today, ASRC are the largest independent human rights organisation for refugees and people seeking asylum, delivering more services on the ground than any other independent asylum seeker organisation in the country. Offering more than 40 holistic programs that protect people seeking asylum from persecution and destitution, support well-being and dignity, and empower people to advance their own future. Programs include a weekly food and groceries service, healthcare, legal aid and employment support and the operation of a new social enterprise arm.

\xa0


Benefits & Culture

  • Additional Meals and Entertainment Salary Packaging
  • 1 Rostered Day Off every month
  • 4 weeks annual leave with 17.5% leave loading per annum
  • 2 additional weeks paid leave at Christmas (at times determined by the ASRC)
  • 22 days personal leave per annum
  • 10 days compassionate leave
  • 12 weeks paid parental leave after 12 months service (maternity and paternity leave both 12 weeks)
  • Professional Development and Paid Study Leave
  • Free lunch daily at the ASRC
  • Free car and bicycle parking available

\xa0


The Role

Working closely with the founder and chief executive officer you will ensure operational excellence through all the corporate functions including finance, business analysis, HR, risk management including work health and safety, quality, compliance, IT/business systems, and business planning.

\xa0

Specifically you will operationalise the new strategic plan, maintain the current framework ensuring performance measures are robust, aligned and driving business growth. You will project manage a transformational IT systems upgrade across all organisational streams and drive a budget review, analyse workflows and review the risk framework. You will form part of the finance audit and risk committee and prepare monthly board reports and attend board meetings.


\xa0

Skills Required

You are currently operating at a senior level in a similar operational role in a complex organisation supervising sustainable financial practices and models, you have been integral in supporting organisational growth and managing a wide range of projects and internal functions across core business operations. Via your already successful career in the not for profit sector, leading charities or like-minded corporates you’re able to demonstrate a deep understanding of an organisational culture required to successfully deliver program outcomes whilst driving business success.

\xa0

You are a confident leader and stakeholder manager with conflict resolution skills and possess a genuine interest in employee wellbeing and development promoting a positive and ethical working environment. You have shown high levels of relationship building skills and can communicate comfortably with a diverse demographic. Outline where the ideal candidate is currently working and then more broadly describe other experience they may have; this is typically a couple of sentences followed by bullet points highlighting essential skills/experience.

\xa0

\xa0

If you are driven to deliver a robust transformational operational framework to enable this highly respected NFP to keep delivering support to people seeking asylum then please click apply, submitting your application in MS Word format including your resume, a covering letter including responses to the skills required above, quoting reference #34517 or contact Anna Skeels on (03) 8319 4070.

\xa0

\xa0

Please note that there is no formal closing date for this role. Early applications are encouraged and suitable candidates may be shortlisted for interview as applications are received.
